title: 1970's Script Logo
content:
Any ideas what font was used in this 1970’s-designed logo (could have even been late 60’s)? I believe this one was originally scanned in (and is starting to look quite grainy by this point). It looks much better on the old stationery.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024060947im_/http:/typophile.com/files/oakledge_logo_small_brightg2%20copy_4734.jpg)

 [‹ Need Some Help On This Slab Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024060947/http:/typophile.com/node/50820 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looks a bit like Frutiger, but it is definitive not. Any ideas? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024060947/http:/typophile.com/node/50822 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SunapeeDux

comments.content:
It looks hand-drawn to me. The ’e’s are very different.

- Lex

If you are confident in your Illustrator/lettering/design skills, you might try redrawing it yourself in AI. If you are less confident about doing it yourself, you might hire someone else to do this task for you. For logos in particular, I find that a lettering option is typically better than a font option, particularly in cases like these.
Good catch on the ’e’s. I didn’t even notice that. Very helpful feedback! Thank you both so much. I’ll see what I can manage...
